intro: Dodecasperma acutifolia, commonly known as the sharpleaf dodecasperma, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds, though it is not closely related to them. The plant is characterized by its small, green, palmate leaves and yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands or along riverbanks. Dodecasperma acutifolia is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
